result.execSummary:
The defendant Quentin B Hazelwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges by 10/13/15, any bail on deposit to apply. If unpid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quentin B Hazelwood

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Steven H Glamm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court sentences defendant to serve 3 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by 10-13-2015, any bail on deposit to apply.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

At the parties request, case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing on 04/10/2015 at 01:30 p.m. in Room 634 of the Courthouse, Judge Dee presiding.
cab

Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-20-2015 at 01:30 pm.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.

Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 04-07-2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Quentin B Hazelwood
Current: 9136 N 85th St Upper, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 02-10-2015)
Prior: 9136 N 85th St, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($100.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 100.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Quentin B Hazelwood not in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/28/15 @ 1:30 pm
